review: Now we had just finished a run and were in need of some protein and carbs to replenish what we had just used up. Pizza came into mind because it was a great way of getting our carbs and protein in but the problem is finding a healthy pizza. That's when my friend decided on California Pizza Kitchen. I was skeptic at first but quickly my mind was changed after we had our meal.  For the pizza we had gone with wild mushroom with the truffle oil of course because truffle. We had shared it and it was more than enough for a light meal. The truffle oil with the mushroom combination definitely made this one a go to choice for me.  Then for a salad we went with a half size of Thai crunch and goodness did this pack a punch(call of duty reference). I'm slightly biased when it comes to anything Thai related just because of the peanut dressing and combination of veggies. The half of it was more than enough and we did share it. I couldn't imagine eating the full size but it would seem like a great size if you really want a salad and have more people with you to eat.  We didn't wait at all we were shown to a table very quickly and the service was great, our waiter was kind. We did get our food before the bread, not a big deal but we were kind of hoping to get something before our food to snack on. Overall I will have to come again to try more of the pizzas and other food options they offer.

Went to CPK for a quick dinner last night. It took almost two hours.  We each had soup-- arrived in ten minutes My wife ordered flatbread  I ordered fish tacos  After 40 minutes her flat bread arrived, since it was warm(not hot) I asked her to go ahead and start  As she finished, I asked for the manager who arrived ten minutes later after stopping and sitting with a friend at another table. She finally arrived as my main tacos did. She gave the normal so sorry she offered a free key lime pie which took another ten minutes  I wanted out before I started to scream at the server. As the pie arrive I asked for the check and that took another ten minutes as did waiting to sign the check   Never again.  This experience re-enforcers my dislike for chain restaurant.

If you are at the mall and you don't want to eat at the food court this is a perfect alternative. Even though I come here all the time without even entering the mall. This specific location is actually attached to the mall so it might be confusing to someone that doesn't know the area.  Anyways I really like the pizza from here I usually get the margarita or the mushroom with truffle oil is soooo good! They bring the truffle oil out in a little container so you can add it yourself as you please. (Perfect for parents who have picky eaters as kids). But what I really love about this place is the Thai crunch salad! It's my absolute favorite salad ever!!!! I love how it has peanuts and they put two different types of dressing that's fresh but tangy at the same time. They also have two sizes which is perfect because you can either get a portion for yourself or a portion for the whole table. And I recommend that if you order the Thai crunch add the avocado,(Thank me later).The hummus is great as well they bring it out with warm pita perfect to share right before the salad.  I haven't actually gotten any of the desserts because I'm usually stuffed after all the hummus and salad and pizza but hopefully one day soon I'll try it.  Inside tip: it's really cold inside, they have a balcony outside where you can usually get a table but the waiters sometimes forget about you.

Average service and average food.  We started out with the bread, its wss sour doue with olive oil and herbs. Good combined together.  My daughter had a kids pizza with cheese and mushrooms, she seemed to like it. My wife had pizza too, it had broccoli, mushrooms, Eggplant and roasted corn with no cheese.  My said it was very good except it wasn't very hot. I had  the jumbleia  with fettuccine, except it had linguini. I guess the kitchen doesn't know the difference. It was good. It had a nice amount of shrimp and chicken and a good amount of spice.   We did have one small problem, its not worth saying what it was, but I will say the manager was quick to handle it.

This california pizza kitchen is located within the Pembroke Lakes mall. Its a great spot for a girls day out lunch (just like my last visit) but I would say its a little pricey for a pit stop lunch on a shopping mall kind of day.  The service was quick and friendly on the afternoon that I came and the server was also very attentive and patient. The atmosphere is nice yet casual. I order the chicken piccata, which was nothing out of this world, however it did hit the spot. The portion is enough for lunch and even to have some leftovers later as a snack. My friend ordered the brussel sprout and bacon flatbread to share. Beware, this is not healthy! It is yummy and salty, but definitely not for the health conscious.  I dont not have anything bad to say about this restaurant but because of the price, this would not be my go to lunch spot.

Been coming to CPK since they opened here and generally solid food and service. Had a nice seasonal martini to start and then it was downhill from there. My wife orders salmon, they bring halibut and claim it's a white salmon...uhh no, I know what salmon is, also  my flatbread was cold too. Usually you have a manager come out, this time the chef from the kitchen who explained some salmon from the atlantic is white! Only thing  that's white is maybe salmon trout but this was halibut ...but we waited around for the remake,  they did and of course it was pink... but overcooked. You'd think they'd admit mistake or comp error but nope. Sticking w pizzas and basic fare here. Service was great, waitress was pleasant.
Great pizza, great food and good service. Second time in the restaurant it has not disappointed. I recommend this restaurant when in the mall and even if you are not going shopping.

This is a great restaurant for fast, casual dine-in! I've been coming here since with friends and family for about 7 years now and I've never had a bad experience. Never bothered to review it until today, but decided to because of our extremely nice server, Lily. It's been a while since I've been impressed by the service in a restaurant, but Lily was so nice and attentive with everything. Upon ordering, I was about to go with my usual, which is the half Chinese chicken salad, but she convinced me to try something new and go with the Thai crunch. It's actually become my new favorite and I'll definitely go again to try it. I know CPK is a pizza place, but I really like their salads there. Not sure how healthy they are, but I justify it with all the veggies that are in it, ha! Over the years, the menu has generally stayed the same but my favorites are still there, and some new yummy food items as well! My dad got the banh mi bowl, and I was pretty impressed by how colorful and yummy looking it was. It's definitely on my list of things to try. My mom wasn't that hungry and ordered a bianco flatbread, which was alright. Overall a great experience, especially for lunch!

5 stars for what it is: a fast casual dine-in restaurant. The wait was short, the waiter Mike was very pleasant and engaging.  Our meals came out in great time and were delicious! We had the spicy buffalo cauliflower (although a bit overpriced for the size of the plate), the mushroom pizza, and two types of salad (bbq chopped without chicken, and quinoa + arugula).  First time there and I'd definitely return.

This is a 4 star for my husband's lunch. He really liked his turkey, Brie, and shaved pear sandwich which he ordered with a Mediterranean salad. My small pizza was quite good although I didn't expect the sausage to be as spicy (it had big red pepper flakes in the chunks) and came with my ordered Caesar salad. I didn't eat the salad -- not a fan of wilted dark greens. The way to go for lunch is this mix and match of soups, salads plus pizza and sandwiches. Think next time I'll go with one of the soups and the pizza without the sausage or a different salad.

This was my most pleasant experience in Florida! The staff was so welcoming and gave wonderful recommendations.  The manager spoke about how they cook their food and came to speak to us because we were first timers. It was very pleasant. The food was also very good. I'd recommend everyone come here for good service and great food.

Had a nice time for my first time at this place.I had the BBQ chicken pizza and tortilla soup lunch special the pizza was soooo good, the tortilla soup wasn't really my thing but it was fine. Our waitress, Shakira, was really nice and friendly as well!

Havent been here in a few years but everytime ive come its been pretty good. Our waiter was a little unattentive which was annoying since we kept having to ask someone to get him for us. Otherwise food is still good, love their fresh lemonades. We tried for the first time their avocado egg rolls, boy were they amazing! So full of flavor and very filling! Will be def ordering those every time. Their pizza always on point, love how they add fresh herbs to give the pizza an extra yummy taste. Their lunch combos are great deal, def worth coming at that time. Overall glad its still around and doing well.

Very bad service! I request more bread and my waiter continue cleaning tables instead of bringing bread. When he finally did was together with the food. Very disappointed! Usually is not like this. Probably a very bad day!

Avocado egg roll(it has chicken, bacon and cheese in it).......you have to get it!  Kentucky mule....you have to get it! Carne asada pizza....you have to get it! Tammy O. was our server and she was great. All the selections i recommended were from her!

Came for a quick dinner before returning some things at the mall. 2 salads and an appetizer $39+ tip. It's overpriced for the quality of the food. The service was great and food wasn't bad but bang for your buck isn't there.

It has been years since I've eaten at CPK and not sure why. The food was great and they actually have a good kids menu. The kid had the grilled chicken and broccoli which was very tasty and he loved it. The wife and I split the avocado egg rolls and a California club pizza which did not disappoint. It won't be long until we return.

I went in for a beer and some avocado egg rolls . My bartender cythnia  offered me a Kentucky bourbon  Barrel ale  which they recently  added to the draft beer selection . I was pleasantly  surprised  that it was offered at only $ 6.29 since the pub at pembroke gardens sells it at $10.00 . I will definitely  go back and the service was excellent not to mention the avocado  egg rolls are out of this world .

Came in for a quick bite with my boyfriend. I am a first time guest and I love the atmosphere. Great lighting. I sat at the bar and had the Brussels and bacon flatbread as well as the spinach and mushroom flatbread. Grace was a fabulous bar tender. She was super friendly and I never had to ask her for anything. My drinks were cold and made quickly. She seems to be a great multitasker, doing many things at once. The restaurant was very very clean. I would defiantly come again.

I used to love this place when they first opened but I didn't really like my salad this time. Didn't seem restaurant quality and I wouldn't order it again. It was the BBQ chicken chopped salad. My sedona tortilla corn chowder was tasty however. I feel we waited too long to be seated on a Saturday late afternoon, more than 30 minutes for a party of 6.

I'll start off by saying, this place got lucky with the three stars. I'll warrant them considering the dishes I picked on my last visit were really great. I've been here a handful of times, each time very spaced out from the last time, but Yelp suggested I write this review and be more involved in the community so here I am... Typing away..... Anyways, service really blows here. Any location I've been too, one thing remains, the FOH hiring manager sucks. My waitress was within arms distance of me and I spent most of my meal waiving her down. My boyf nearly finished his beer before she returned to the table to take our order. We ordered a small plate, the white corn guacamole, cause uh duh camole' and it was really good. Alittle bland in flavor, but nothing like and salt couldn't fix. We decided to split the Harvest Kale salad and a chipotle chicken pizza. We obviously went with the veg option and swapped the chicken out for avocado. Dude, first off the full order of the salad is ridic. Order a half unless you're hungry enough to eat a horse. My man and I couldn't even take it down, but que clasé ensalada meng. Baby kale, toasted farro, heirloom carrots, napa cabbage, red grapes, marinated cranberries, sliced pear , almonds and goat cheese tossed in a house made citrus vinaigrette. This salad has a little bit of a kick to it but it is really good. Like really, really, good. The pizza was great too, three cheese mix, avocados, topped off with a spicy chipotle sauce and a black bean corn salsa. It was toasted to perfection and a lime cream drizzled all over. Uff that shit was delicious. We opted out of dessert considering I would have waited 10 years for my waitress to come back, but whatever. I flagged her down just to get my tab. She then drops off the check and never returned? Like hey, I coulda walked out and you'd never know. Left the cash with the hostess and made my way home.  My suggestion, stop by with some time on your hands, order two drinks ahead and have your order ready to go when your server decides to show.
Order the Asian salad, did not particular like it next time will order something else. Server was fast and friendly.
Service is not that great here. Was treated poorly and food didn't even come out hot. I can get pizza lots of other places to be honest.
My fiancé & I go here every single week for our date night. We love the service and their food. Such great ambience! Their strawberry shortcake is so good! That's what we had as our dessert tonight.
I had a California pizza pie with my friend,it was fresh and good.The service was good too.I will be back.
Ordered the spaghetti, wouldn't order it again. The pasta was 75% of the plate with only 25% of meat sauce. So basically I spend $25 on cooked dry pasta.

Food is pretty good but unfortunately last nights dinner experience was very frustrating. My daughter and I were shopping all day and decided to end the night with our favorite pizza. Service at ANY establishment can make or break ur night... With that being said, the waiter forgot my daughters drink order, never brough me a water (when i asked for one on 3 different occasions), came back to the table 20 minutes after we placed our order to tell us the chef made us the wrong appetizer so it would b a few more minutes, ordered a second glass of wine but "forgot" so it was brought at the same time as the check (1/2 way done with dessert). Ended up ordering a "to go" order for my husband and it took 40 minutes. Never did I think I would spend 2 hours in a California pizza kitchen. It's my "go to" when shopping all day but I'll stick to the Sawgrass location when craving the pear + gorgonzola pizza.

Went to CPK in Pembroke Pines Mall. It was Tuesday night there wasn't that many people. Second time being here! The service was excellent our waiter Frankie was very attentive. We ordered the avocado egg rolls of course as an appetizer they're amazing. Had a sangria to drink very refreshing!! For Entree, I ordered my one year old off the kids menu the grilled chicken with broccoli it was really good (I took a bite of course) he enjoyed it. My seven year old had their pepperoni pizza off the kids menu the portion is decent size for a kid. My husband had the meat lovers, he enjoyed it, it's definitely for meat lovers it was fully loaded. I had the wild mushroom pizza I absolutely love mushroom and this pizza was delicious. The mushroom was fresh the pizza was cooked to perfection. These pizzas are large portions we didn't have room for dessert. I was in the mood for pizza and since we were in the area decided to go back! Will be back more often!

I've only been here a few times, and all I've ordered has been their pizza. They do have a nice selection of pizza with various flavor profiles, but I think they are a bit overpriced. A few of my favorite pizzas here would be their Original BBQ Chicken, Pear + Gorgonzola and their Jamaican Jerk Chicken.  The service wasn't that great either from what I can recall; they just seem to be going through the motions.

I have been here so many times and each time worse than the last. Today not only did a server knock me over and refuse to apologize I was offered no compensation for the poor food and terrible service. I'm contacting corporate this week. I've given this place enough chances.

Last night again my girlfriend and I are at the california pizza kitchen. In PEMBROKE pines. The food is   girlfriend and I ate the chicken picatta and the bacon and brussel bacon flatbread. And of course the Avo Egg rolls. Our favorite.and of course Chelsey our Waitresses is Amazing. And full of personality. We just love her. I also had a sam adams ipa and sample the Kentucky burbon ale. So good. Will be back.

Their club egg rolls are the BEST egg rolls hands down. Their service was great. I was pleasantly surprised when a friend suggested we eat at CPC. They have a diverse menu with many options to choose from.

We had a really good time, our first time here ... Kids had a kid pepperoni pizza and I had chicken tequila fettuccini, it was a HUGE portion ..& soooo good ..   Plus a delish margarita... (Kuddos to whoever made it)...  Price are VERY REASONABLE , I paid $40 for 3 meals and drinks ...  And FRANKIE (Our server) WAS GREAT.. , will definitely come back soon :). Very happy ..

The place was not busy at yet we waited way to long for our food. When it finally arrived, it wasn't very hot. I wasn't impressed by my server either. She seemed distracted and did not want to be there. With all the options in the area, I will not go back,
I love this place.. Prices can be a little high and I was very upset when they removed the garlic shrimp pizza from the menu, but I've never left unhappy just stuffed.

The pear and gorgonzola thin crust pizza was excellent!  Prepared with lots of thin slices of pears and gorgonzola cheese.  It had a heap of salad on top, which I didn't expect to see.  But it did go well together.  My friend and I shared the pizza and the California  Cobb salad, which was very good.  Fortunately, we were able to walk off that big lunch walking around at the mall afterwards.
Great gluten free pizza, excellent service, very recommended. Is good to know that there are places that cares about gluten intolerance. I'll be back!

I had the California Fields Salad which is a wonderful and savory blend of greens, fresh strawberries, watermelons, pistachios, feta and champagne dressing. I added an ordered of grilled shrimp and my dinner was amazing. There are no excuses to eat clean while going out. This place definitely has plenty of options.  Our server also refilled our water glasses many times and was happy to do so and very accommodating.  Definitely, on my "I can have cake" days,  I will try their epic (according to everyone), Butter Cake which comes with some ice cream on top. Im told people just show up to this place to have coffee and cake, and that's pretty awesome. I also want to give thanks to their manager Peter Rose, for being very helpful in looking over their menu before deciding to stay for dinner. It was them or Red Robin. Nothing against Red Robin, but glad I made the choice to try this spot on.  Definitely will come again!
2 stars for the food (which is good), but 0 stars for the service. It's not even the servers' faults. It seems that management gives them a painful, awkward, robotic speech.
On a recent visit I must say service has definitely improved, I was greeted and seated as soon as I arrived. The food was fresh and  tasted great.

Best choice at Pembroke Lakes Mall since it far exceeds the food court.  The pizzas are always good and I've never had a problem with the service.  Their avocado rolls are one of the best out there.  I do feel disappointed that they've removed some of my favorite pizzas off the menu (shrimp scamp pizza).  None of the ones I've tried since have reached the level of goodness.

BBQ salad is very good and their pizzas are very enjoyable.  I also always have the split pea and barley soup which is something I seldom find elsewhere and is a nice treat, My biggest complaint is that I always ask for the wheat crust and they never have it when I go. If the place is crowded, getting soda refills may take a while, but usually any server is willing to help you out if you need anything else at the table.

Ok pizza, nice restaurant, nothing to go crazy about.  It's allot better to eat here than in the loud, obnoxious food court. I'll give them that much credit. Other than that, the pizza selection was mediocre and bland. Portions were just ok too.

The food here is Ok,  pizza is not one of my favorites.  Best item I've tried so far is the thai chicken salad which is disappointing in a pizza place.  The portions are small and a little over priced for the quality of the food. The service is not that good and I was provided dirty silverware.  I asked for a additional plate 3x and finally gave up and asked the manager for it.  The temperature in the restaurant was also warmer than I cared for. Not one of my favorites.
Great service, I had the most wonderful server at California Pizza Kitchen at Pines Mall.  Food is a little more expensive, but I like it a lot
This was a very good experience, they have wifi so I was able to do a working lunch and they prepared an ítem that is no longer on the menú. Very good service.

I met my cousin at the mall and we ate here because it was much cosier than the food court.  We split a thin crust and the mushrooms was incredible. It had several types of fresh not canned mushrooms and cooked just right.  My cousin liked her peperoni too.  Best of all they deliver!!!  I can't wait to order from work!

We like coming here during the week for lunch. Even though it's in the mall, it doesn't get too crowded if you go at the right time. The pizza is great, and they have small plates if you want to sample lots of stuff. Something for everyone.

I like California Pizza Kitchen for a few reasons. They are an original pizza company with very unique pizzas.  Some of them are awesome and other not for me.  They are pricey so depending on your budget they are great!

Stopped by to have a pizza while walking through the mall at lunch time.  Server was pleasant, and atmosphere wasnt bad.  It does get busy at times during lunch.   Tried the BLT pizza on the wheat dough.  Great combination! The bacon and cheese was baked onto the wheat dough, and then it was topped with lettuce / mayo mixture and sliced tomatoes.  Highly recommend the cheeseburger pizza as well. They dont have lunch specials, so keep that in mind if your looking for a budget $5-$6 /per person lunch.

Recently celebrated my daughters 9th birthday at California Pizza Kitchen after reading they did parties in a local magazine.  I will say I was very skeptical at first.  When we first called the manager was very nice and accommodating with the info.  He asked what date we wanted to reserve and thats it!  Didn't ask for money or to sign anything.  I kept asking my husband to call and make sure we were all set and we were!  The morning of the party we called the restaurant and asked how much time we had to come in and decorate.  They said come in whenever you want!  The party was perfect.  The chef was extremely patient with all the kids.  Our host and the manager were very accommodating.  We did not feel rushed as the parties are done before the restaurant opens.  We had a whole section to ourselves.  The kids loved making their own pizza.  Easiest and I all say easiest on the pocket party we have ever  had.  I will totally recommend having your next event here.  My daughter and her friends had a wonderful day!

CPK has some of the best pizza and salads too!  Another thing I enjoy there is that you can also enjoy a refreshing cocktail!  I don't love the seating.  I feel like I'm in a Denny's but I haven't had anything but a pleasant experience there.

I LOVE California Pizza Kitchen! I know...its super chain food, but  love them. This location was great...the service was sooo nice and friendly, a lot of other diners seemed to be regulars which was kind of cool.
The menu has improved a bit. Thin crust Mexican pizza is really yummy. Service is okay and it's not an everyday place to go eat at.
Awesome salads and appetizers! Great costumer service! Pizzas are super thin crust and deliciouuusss!!
I love the bar b que chicken salad.  My wife loves the pizza and soup.  Try the red velvet cake!!!!!!  Parking is the only issue.  Would go more often if they had better parking.

Got pizza delivered through prime takeout. Mushroom pizza, mac & cheese balls, and a chocolate cake to split. All of these things were absolutely abysmal. The pizza was cold, thin, and chewy. The mac & cheese balls were cold and dry, and the cake... I don't know how you mess up chocolate cake, but it was honest to god one of the worst I've had.

Very dissatisfied with my visit, soda came out without aspartame, ordered asparagus and spinach pasta which came out with other types of pasta including peanuts while I'm allergic to peanuts. Cheese pizza was served to my vegetarian girlfriend tasting of bacon... management began to defend the mistake instead of fixing the issue. After refusing to speak to me.

Try the avacado egg rolls and Jamaican jerk chicken pizza. Nice quiet place for a brunch with your lady friend! You get alot of bang for your buck. I would not recommend any of thier "small plates" just stick to the appetizers and pizza.

Ok so this is my first time here. Service was great! Our server would refill our drinks every time we would finish them. We ordered two quesadilla plates from the small plate menu which was pretty tasty. It had 4 slices with a spicy dipping sauce. We ordered a Hawaiian pizza and to our surprise when it came out it was soooo small for the both of us. I am a petite girl and I was left hungry. It is 10 inches and as pricey as an extra large pizza from another pizza chain like Papa Johns or Dominoes. It would have been nice to have let us know that it was so small so that we would have ordered more.  The pizza was tasty, but definitely not out of this world. Overall it was a nice experience.

For a chain restaurant in a mall they have a very good selection of dishes with really good quality ingredients and a good starter wine selection which I did not expect. Had their signature BBQ chicken pizza and a salad with gorgonzola and walnuts which was very good. Awesome lemonade and a decent red velvet cake ( not cheesecake factory or grande luxe quality) but still good!

So, this is a chain restaurant....but, it's a stand out.  The food is terrific, and the prices don't make me feel like I was taken advantage of.  It's consistently good, and they have seasonal options and specials that keep bringing me back.   They are always promoting a local charity, and support tons of fundraisers.   Service, for me, has been off the chart. There's always a manager in sight, and the team seems to be happy.  I'm there with my family twice a month.  Some favorites: Pear and Gorgonzola Pizza, Four Cheese Ravioli, Thai Crunch Salad.

The place looks clean, great music and the service somehow good. However, what turned me off was the very limited small pizzas  and Flatbread options in the menu. It was my first time visiting CPK and I didn't enjoy the fact that I have to almost beg the server in order to get a lunch size Margarita Pizza. I was going to a pizza place and I expected to have a larger variety.  I did get what I wanted after suggesting that I was going to pay for the extra topping on my pizza.

The 2 stars are for the water I finally got.  Twelve waitstaff walking/standing around in an empty restaurant and we were seated next to the staff eating and drinking WATER.  Our waitress was socializing at the bar.  I finally nabbed another waitress and pleaded for a drink 10 minutes in. She also took our order and refreshed my drink.  The waitress at the bar came and introduced herself finally and served the pizza.  I wish I could find the waitress who did most of the work to tip her.  Pizza was good.  Management shouldn't sit patrons next to the staff hanging out and eating.  Profanity, flirting and slapping towels.  Nice kids, but I didn't need to hear it.

I decided to order Delivery through the Eat24 app brought to you by Yelp. I thought well because it's yelp, I could possibly trust it. It took over two hours and when my food arrived the driver was rude and the food was stone cold. Also I ordered a smore's dessert and it was like $7, I have a picture because all I got was tiny amount of melted marshmallows? I tried to complain to eat24 and there is no one to get in contact with that can answer any questions or concerns. Also it was a 29.5% mark up for all costs. I spent $59.99- $46.00 food cost and $13 up charge! It's not worth it.

Was here about a year ago and nothing has changed unless you call less customers a change. The food is repulsive and the service is better and more efficient at Mc Donald's. Had a Caesar salad and the lettuce was brown and wilted, being known for their pizza you would think that would at least be good, nope tasted as though it was frozen and reheated from the day before.  Our server looked like she was gang member and was completely unprofessional and walked as though she was at home in her bedroom slippers shuffling into her kitchen for her morning coffee rather then hustling in a restaurant. The manager made his appearance at the end of the meal and looked like he was going to doze off standing by the table, he also looked confused after seeing my uneaten salad and just stood there not knowing what to say to the point I was actually embarrassed for him. Would give it zero stars if I could, praying I don't get sick from what little I ate.

CPK has some pretty darn good and tasty food for a chain. I love their pizzas, and I am particularly partial to their Baja Fish Tacos as well.  The service in this CPK was really good, I hate to say that I forgot the name of the server because he was attentive, efficient and did the right amount of up selling without being pushy.  All in all a good experience and good food!

This place has changed. It should now be called California Salad Kitchen. While the pizza is still there, they have taken most of them out of the menu. I ordered pepperoni, sausage and mushroom while my wife ordered pepperoni, You know, it just was not that good. What a shame! Cheesecake factory makes a better cheese pizza now. They also took out the hot fudge and caramel sundae out of the menu. The kids sundaes were crap. We looked around and it seemed as if the salads were pretty good. Maybe we'll go back for salads, but I'm not bothering to go there for pizza anymore. Why did they tweak the menu for the worst?
This review is for the franchise in general; a personal pizza should never cost more than $10, period, regardless if the pizza is "gourmet" or not.
Amazingly unimpressive pizza :( Maybe everything else is really good. On the other hand if you don't like the taste of pizza and prefer ingredient on bread this place is for you.

Hands down they have the best hummus in town.  Pizza place with good hummus you ask?  My response try it and you will see.  Another shocker- they have the best salads EVER!!  My personal fav-the barbeque chicken salad. Now for the pizzas-must haves are the mediterrain, tostada and the new mushroom pizza.  New plus-you can put goat cheese on the pizzas now.

I just cant give a Pizza Joint 5 stars. I will say that this is a great Pizza. Our Server, Brittany was a doll. The person I was with drinks a lot of diet Coke, up to 6 or 7 glasses and we told our server that she should bring them two at a time to save her the trouble. She was spot on every time the glass was near empty. Spinach dip was great and had more cheese than most I've tasted. Price was pretty good and service was great.

I came here with a friend to watch the game and get some pizza. It was pretty quiet and peaceful in there. We sat at the bar and there were less than a handful of people total there. The bartender took forever for every single task. I learned this after her bringing us the beer, so at that point I tried to make sure to get everything I would  need from her so I wouldn't have to wait 20 minutes for a napkin. Even waiting on the food took a good 45 minutes after the waitress put the order in. The pizza was good and I was hoping it was because it took forever and a day to get.  As further proof that it took forever my beer was straight warm when the pizza arrived. The place has its ups and its downs. The pizza was good , but if you are going there with the intent on leaving quick just DON'T. Really don't even kid yourself cause your in for the long haul.
LOVE CPK! Great pizza, and good service. I really enjoy their sauces and dough.

Fun place to eat while at the mall. Many families go here with young children even though they serve alcohol   Anyhow for appetizers we had Chicken Dumplings: just regular dumplings... Lettuce Wraps: personally i didnt like the chicken, i normally eat only white meat, i felt as if it was fatty like chicken thighs  Spinach Artichoke Dip: definitively my favorite, very cheesy and tasteful Pizzas Pesto Chicken (thin crust): excellent pizza, i absolutely loved it and would return just for this  Five Cheese + Fresh Tomato: ehh... didnt like it very much
Went with my nephews on Friday and they both had a pizza each and I had the original Santa Fe chicken salad! It aw yummy as always and the service friendly, fast and great price.
